summary: Crimea is a peninsula in Eastern Europe, surrounded by the Black Sea and the Sea of Azov. It has a long history of different rulers, including Greeks, Romans, and the Ottoman Empire. Russia took control in the 18th century, and it became part of Ukraine in 1954. In 2014, Russia took over Crimea again, but many countries still consider it part of Ukraine. The region is known for its strategic location and has faced conflicts over its ownership.
title: Crimea
